citeinfo.title: NGEE Arctic Tram: Continuous Soil Moisture and Temperature Measurements across Low- and High-Centered Polygonal Ground, Barrow, Alaska, 2014-2016

descript.abstract:
This data set reports the continuous soil moisture and temperature measurements collected from August of 2014 to September of 2016 along the footprint of the NGEE Arctic Tram.
Soil moisture and temperature sensors are installed adjacent to the Tram at 8 locations of varying land surface types across the low-centered and high-centered polygonal ground. While the Tram operates seasonally these soil measurements are recorded year around.
Data for the remainder of 2016 and 2017 will be added when available.
Dataset citation: Baptiste Dafflon, Margaret Torn, et al. 2017. NGEE Arctic Tram: Continuous Soil Moisture and Temperature Measurements across Low- and High-Centered Polygonal Ground, Barrow, Alaska, 2014-2016. Next Generation Ecosystem Experiments Arctic Data Collection, Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center, Oak Ridge National Laboratory, Oak Ridge, Tennessee, USA. Data accessed at http://dx.doi.org/10.5440/1374599.

method.methdesc:
The Tram is located at the NGEE Arctic tundra study site on the Barrow Environmental Observatory (BEO) in Intensive Site 1, just south of Area A. It consists of 68 m of elevated track and a fully automated cart equipped with a suite of radiation and remote sensing instruments that traverses this distance on a daily schedule. The Tram stops every 0.5 meter to record measurements with stops that are coincident with the 8 soil measurement locations.
Soil measurements were acquired with a programmed Campbell Scientific CR1000 data logger.
